channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown bushes blocking pavement, 19th June
item.description:
Overgrown bushes blocking the pavement and making it dangerous for pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Thorny foliage encroaching onto the pavement, 19th June
item.description:
Thorny foliage (blackberry bushes) is encroaching onto the pavement from the front garden of 1 Beaumont Road. This is dangerous as school children walk by on their way to school and the thorny bushes could hit them in the face or eyes. Please can you contact the property owner and request that these bushes are clipped back to the property boundary as soon as possible. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive Flytips!, 19th June
item.description:
Massive Flytip partially blocking entrance to Weir Hall Avenue cul-de-sac N18. This must have been dumped by someone using a van or lorry so surely Enfield Council will be gathering video doorbell evidence and CCTV footage to investigate this.....Won't you?? Residents are sick and tired of people just dumping stuff around here because they know there is no consequences!!! I watched a guy come out of his house the other day and dumped stuff on the grass outside my house and just laughed at me when I challenged him. Enfield Council need to do something that stops this illegal dumping!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction, 19th June
item.description:
Dear sir/Madam, I live at 269 Burnt Oak Lane, DA15 8LR. There is a car parked next to the entrance of 267 Burnt Oak Lane, which severely obstructs my view when reversing. Yesterday, I almost had an accident because there is a bend here, and drivers can't see me reversing, and I can't see any incoming cars. If possible, I hope two double yellow lines can be painted here. Kind regards Jingping Lu

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 273, Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can you please ask the gardeners team of council and etc to clean grass, grounds and the playground area nearby to be cleaned and to be kept in very good quality standards for the sake of all the residents of Kelly Avenue and Watts Street SE15 5GL., 19th June
item.description:
Please keep the grass and grounds in clean and tidy conditions on constant schedule. We shouldn't even spend our time to complain about cleanliness and tidiness conditions of the public areas such as parks, playgrounds and grass areas between the pavements and roads. It's absolutely common sense to keep it clean and tidy without us to need to complain about it, because it must be done constantly on arranged reasonable schedule.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Kelly Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
